summary: Desktop PC app to paste links and organize them into a clean, accessible library with a UI styled like a game options menu.
architectural_notes: Add a theme/contrast system (e.g., light/dark tokens) so text and accent colors are derived from background luminance/contrast rules rather than hardcoded (remove orange accent).

Ensure theme/colors remain stable during scroll (no scroll-triggered theme/contrast recalculation or CSS/JS that changes background/text/accent colors on scroll); enforce fixed black background with white text + white accents.
known_issues: Colors/theme unexpectedly change when scrolling; user wants permanently black background, white text, and white accents with no scroll-dependent changes.

existing_features.title: Create a desktop-PC-friendly UI that lets users paste a URL to add it to their library, view their saved links, and open a selected link in a new browser tab/window.
Add library management actions in the UI: edit a saved link and delete a saved link, with accessible confirmation for destructive actions.
Integrate frontend data flow with the backend canister using React Query for fetching/mutating the user’s link library, including loading and error states.
Apply a clean visual theme styled like a game options menu across the app (consistent typography, spacing, panels, focus states), optimized for mouse + keyboard navigation on desktop.
Add an authentication entry point using Internet Identity so users can sign in/out and have a separate personal link library.
Generate and include static visual assets to support the game-options-menu look and render them from the frontend as static files.

Update the global theme color tokens so the UI no longer uses orange/colored accents, and so the primary/accent colors resolve to neutral black/white depending on the current theme (light vs dark). Implement this by adjusting the CSS custom properties in `frontend/src/index.css` (e.g., `--primary`, `--primary-foreground`, `--accent`, `--accent-foreground`, `--ring`) so accent/primary styling matches the background/foreground contrast (white on dark theme, black on light theme) while keeping focus rings and borders clearly visible.

Make all user-visible text render in a single consistent color per theme (white in dark theme, black in light theme) by removing/replacing uses of muted/secondary text color classes in app components (e.g., `text-muted-foreground`, `CardDescription` defaults) with the standard foreground color. Ensure this applies across authenticated and unauthenticated screens, including empty states, loading states, subtitles/descriptions, and footer text.
Make the app’s theme permanently dark: black background, white text, and white accents at all times (no light theme), including while scrolling any scrollable areas.

Remove or neutralize any scroll-dependent visual effects that cause perceived color shifts (e.g., translucent overlays/backdrop blur over the background image) so the background reads as solid black during scroll.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a PC app where users can paste any link and add it to an accessible library, with a clean UI resembling a game options menu.
Implement authenticated per-user storage for a link library so a signed-in user can add, list, update, and delete saved links.

Update UI theming so all text uses a consistent color that adapts to background (white on dark, black on light) and replace the orange accent with black/white accents that match the current background for consistent contrast.

projectName: Link Library App (PC-friendly) with Game Options Menu UI
